revised_title: Observations of Earth's Compression Using the Invariable Pendulum at the Cape of Good Hope
tldr: The author describes the process of using an invariable pendulum at the Royal Observatory in Cape of Good Hope to observe the compression of the Earth. The observations were conducted by Fearon Fallows, Captain Ronald, and Mr. Johnson, and the results were compared to previous observations made in London by Captain Sabine. The findings contribute to the understanding of the Earth's figure and its compression.
